column5: Not sure if I'll ever have another fall like this but, I sure have enjoyed this one so far & I think every one I've taken out has TOO, I really hope I haven't been Dreaming, pinch me will you Thanx Richard PS: Not sure if I can get out Sunday but I sure hope so
Nice haul of bass there.  Well done!

great fish!! CONGRATS!  i never fish tubes in fall but im having great success with YUM creyfish patern jigs.  BUT!!  i realy want to try THEM tubes you giving me the URG!  whats the best technique for them?!?!? i know slow presentation is key but how are you working them.  do you have a couple of tips you waht to share small mouth master!
Wow.....Wow......WOW!!!!! Great fish      Can I go fishing with you???? LMAO
You got those smallies on lock!  I think it's time to change the handle over to smallieking the way you've been at it!  Congrats on all the fish, thanks for the pics  -fishindude
All I can say is WOW! Never knew such good bass fishing could be had in November! Thanks for sharing.
WTG Richard ...  the lake I am fishing right now doesn't have any crayfish in it( that I have seen )....  what colour of tubes are u using and how are u rigging them?

I've had different people out this fall & out fished them all at first, when you have 5 or 10 nice smallies in the boat & they have 1, they start wondering what their doing wrong, 1st thing I did was gave them 1 of my rods & told them to slow down, I was using 8 lb Andes green line & a Smoke & Purple fleck tube fished really slow, If I was drifting I didn't get bit, too shallow 7 to 10 fow, so I was casting in front of the boat with the trolling motor on as slow as I could & still have control of the boat, let the tube hit bottom & give it slack line shake the tube 4" to 12" & reel down to it, work it back to boat & repeat, out of all the smallies we hardly felt any hits they just sucked it in & we felt weight & started reeling, the other rods they were using had Power Pro, 10lb Andes, 10lb Flouro Clear, 12 lb P-Line, the 2 - 10lb lines caught a few fish but not many, My father's cousin Pete used 6 lb light green on a 10' rod & had as many as I did on the day they fished but only caught 1, when I started catching fish I was roaring & every one around the lakes would have heard me, but especially the other guys fishing with us & then I'd wave them over to try catching the smallies & telling them to slow down or giving them my rods or tubes to get them on fish. I love catching fish but I also love to have my buddies catching them too. Water was colored a bit but could still see rocks or wood down to 5' to 8' Richard Not trying to blow my own horn but for some reason things just clicked for me this fall

WOW!  Great haul of bass there SBK....i'm sure those who've been out with ya loved it...if not....lol...well...they should take up golf or chess or something....ooooops....hope i dont upset too many golfers....lol...but golf is even worse than cricket!
SBK master of small mouth!  are your tubes scented or something!?!?!  seems like you did master the technique!
A little dab will do ya MEGA STRIKE SCENT Richard
You certainly got them SMB's dialed in Richard Great report and pics!!!  Keep up the great work Thanks for sharing Leechman
Nice fish,but catch them like that in the summer its feeding time give them a break
